text:
Language is the foundation of culture and 
technology. The uniquely human power to implant

complex thoughts into each other's minds, just 
by making sounds, gestures, or marks on paper.

It's a feat of such staggering sophistication that 
the world's most advanced supercomputers can't

compete with the proficiency of a three-year-old 
child. We use this ability all day, every day,

but rarely stop to think about how incredible 
it is. I'm Dr. Rrica Brozovsky, sociolinguist

and certified word nerd, and I've always been 
fascinated with language. Behind every word

and figure of speech is a story about where 
we came from and how we relate to each other.

Join me as we stop to really listen to what we 
say and why we say it--an investigation that

will span the fields of history, biology, 
pop culture, and more. On Otherwords!
